title: Relaxing towards generalized one-body Boltzmann states
abstract:
Isolated quantum systems follow the reversible unitary evolution; if we focus
on the dynamics of local states and observables, they exhibit the irreversible
relaxation behaviors. Here we study the local relaxation process in an isolated
chain consisting of \emph{N} three level systems. Though the entropy of the
full many body state keeps a constant, it turns out the total correlation of
this system approximately exhibits a monotonically increasing behavior. More
importantly, a variation analysis shows that, the total correlation entropy
would achieve its theoretical maximum when each site stays in a generalized
one-body Boltzmann state, which is not solely determined by the energy but also
depends on the spin value of each onsite level. It turns out such a theoretical
correlation maximum is highly coincident with the result obtained from the
exact time dependent evolution. In this sense, the total correlation entropy
well serves as an indicator for the dynamical irreversibility of the
nonequilibrium relaxation in this isolated system.
